questions.text: A 26-year-old woman came in with 12 weeks of missed periods. An ultrasound of her abdomen and pelvis indicated a twin pregnancy, as depicted in the accompanying image. This particular type of twin gestation occurs when the inner cell mass divides:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Within 3 days after fertilization. 

The image illustrates the lambda sign, or twin peak sign, which is characteristic of a dichorionic diamniotic pregnancy. Division of the inner cell mass within the first three days post-fertilization leads to this type of twin arrangement. Chorionicity of the placenta is most accurately assessed through ultrasound between 10 to 13 weeks of pregnancy. In cases of dichorionic twins, a prominent septum can be observed between the two gestational sacs.

questions.text: A 25 year old primigravida giving birth to following child . What condition in the mother is associated with such fetal anomaly?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Pregestational Diabetes mellitus 

Option B:- Caudal regression syndrome is a rare congenital abnormality in which a segment of the spine and spinal cord fails to develop. The severity of the morphologic derangement inversely correlates with residual spinal cord function.

questions.text: The method shown in the image is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Burns Marshall Technique

The image shows marshall burns technique used in the delivery of aftercoming head in breech delivery.

Technique:

•   Baby is allowed to hang by its own weight till the nape of neck is visible. 

•   When the nape of neck is visible under the pubic arch, baby is grasped by the ankles

•    Baby is swung in an arc in an upward and forward direction towards the mother’s abdomen

questions.text: Identify the maneuver shown in the image below:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ritgen’s maneuver

The above image depicts the Ritgen’s maneuver

questions.text: A primigravida woman gives birth to a baby with the following defect. Identify the anomaly.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Craniorachischisis

The above image showing anencephaly and a contiguous bony defect of the spine, is suggestive of craniorachischisis. It occurs due to failure of complete closure of the neural tube.

questions.text: You are performing a cardiotocograph on a woman in labor, and your findings are shown below. What could be the possible cause of these findings?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Umbilical cord compression

The given cardiotocograph shows decelerations that are variable with respect to the size, shape, depth, duration, and timing of uterine contractions. This is indicative of variable decelerations, and the likely cause among the given options is umbilical cord compression.

questions.text: A pregnant woman presented with complaints of passing grape-like vesicles vaginally. A USG scan was done and is shown below. Which of the following hormonal levels need to be checked in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

hCG

The given clinical scenario is suggestive of molar pregnancy and beta hCG levels need to be measured. Molar pregnancy may present with bleeding per vaginum or an acute discharge of vesicular mass per vaginum. On examination, the uterine size is more than the corresponding period of amenorrhea. It shows a characteristic snowstorm appearance on USG.

questions.text: A 33-year-old pregnant woman at 20 weeks of gestation has the following finding on USG. Identify the defect.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Omphalocele

The given ultrasound image shows an anterior abdominal wall defect through which abdominal contents have herniated (indicated with an asterisk). The extruded abdominal contents are covered in a sac. This is typical of omphalocele

questions.text: A 2-month pregnant woman undergoes a sonographic evaluation of fetal parameters. The parameter marked in the USG shown below best measures:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Gestational age 

The parameter shown in the ultrasonography image is crown- rump length (CRL), which is the most accurate parameter used for the sonographic estimation of gestational age in the first trimester. It has an accuracy range of ± 5 days.

questions.text: An Rh-negative patient who did not have access to antenatal care delivered a stillborn fetus as shown in the image. Which of the following is not associated with the fetal condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Oligohydramnios

The pale, oedematous fetus in the image is suggestive of fetal hydrops. Fetal hydrops is associated with polyhydramnios, not oligohydramnios. It often occurs as an effect of iso-immunization in an Rh- negative pregnancy. Other complications that may occur are fetal anemia and hyperbilirubinemia.

questions.text: Identify the grip shown in the image below.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pelvic grip

-  First Grip (Fundal Grip) – Determines which fetal part (head or buttocks) is in the uterine fundus.

-  Second Grip (Umbilical Grip) – Identifies the fetal back and limbs to assess position.

-  Third Grip (Pawlik’s Grip) – Assesses fetal engagement by palpating above the pubic symphysis.

-  Fourth Grip (Pelvic Grip) – Confirms fetal head flexion and descent into the pelvis.

choices.text: Normal diagonal conjugate, reassuring for a vaginal delivery
Short diagonal conjugate, indicating cephalopelvic disproportion
Long diagonal conjugate, suggestive of a contracted pelvis
Average diagonal conjugate, no specific concerns

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman at 36 weeks of gestation presents for a routine antenatal check-up. During the pelvic examination, the obstetrician measures the diagonal conjugate. The measurement is found to be 11 cm. What is the significance of this measurement?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Short diagonal conjugate, indicating cephalopelvic disproportion

Explanation: The diagonal conjugate is an important measurement in obstetrics that helps assess the adequacy of the pelvis for childbirth. It is the distance between the lower border of the symphysis pubis and the sacral promontory.

In this case, a measurement of 11 cm at 36 weeks of gestation is shorter than the average diagonal conjugate. The normal range for diagonal conjugate is approximately 12.5 cm to 13.5 cm. A shorter diagonal conjugate may indicate a contracted pelvis, which can lead to difficulties in the descent of the fetal head during labor, known as cephalopelvic disproportion (CPD).

questions.text: Identify the type of placenta previa shown in the image
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Type 3

Type 1 (Low-lying) – Placenta is near but does not reach the cervix.

Type 2 (Marginal) – Placenta touches the cervix but does not cover it.

Type 3 (Partial) – Placenta partially covers the cervix.

Type 4 (Complete) – Placenta fully covers the cervix

Investigation of choice in placenta previa is CS

questions.text: Identify the maneuver shown in the image below:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Controlled cord traction or modified brandt Andrews method 

The Brandt-Andrews method is a technique used during the third stage of labor to facilitate the delivery of the placenta while minimizing the risk of uterine inversion. This maneuver involves the following steps:

1.	Patient Positioning: The patient lies in a supine position.

2.	Uterine Support: The clinician places one hand just above the symphysis pubis to apply gentle upward pressure, stabilizing the uterus.

3.	Cord Traction: With the other hand, the clinician holds the umbilical cord taut using an artery clamp.

questions.text: A pregnant female delivered a baby with normal, expulsion of an intact placenta. After half hour she started bleeding per vaginaly. On examination she was hypotensive and boggy mass is palpated per abdomen. USG showed. retained placental tissues. Which of the following would be likely finding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Placenta succenturiata 

Placenta succenturiata has one (usual) or more small lobes of placenta placed at a varying margin from the main placental margin. Aleash of vessels connects the small lobe with the main lobe. Many times, succenturiate is retained and it presents as postpartum haemorrhage which may be primary or secondary. Placenta membranacea is unduly large and thin. The placenta develops from both chorion frondosum and chorion leave. it increases chances of placenta previa, retained placenta, PPH. In placenta accreta, all or part of the placenta attaches abnormally to the myometrium. So, either whole or a part of placenta comes out causing PPH.

questions.text: A pregnant woman presented to the clinic with the given fetal presentation. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Frank breech 

A frank breech (otherwise known as an extended breech) is where the baby's legs are up next to its abdomen, with its knees straight and its feet next to its ears. This is the most common type of breech.

questions.text: Which pregnancy sign is shown below
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Piskaceks sign  

These are probable signs of pregnancy seen on bimanual examination

Piskacek’s Sign – Asymmetrical uterine enlargement due to implantation- 8 weeks 

Hegar’s Sign – Softening of the lower uterine segment- 6 weeks 

Goodell’s Sign – Softening of the cervix due to increased vascularity -6 weeks 

Osiander’s Sign – Pulsation of vaginal arteries felt on examination- 8 weeks

questions.text: In which type of pelvis will you see this fetal position
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

ANDROID 

This is ROP position commonly seen in android pelvis. 

Characteristics of android pevis :

•   Narrow subpubic angle

•   Heart shaped inlet 

•   Prominent ischial spines

•   Funnel-shaped pelvic cavity

Labour can be prolonged and can also result in deep transverse arrest

questions.text: A 26 year old pregnant woman has the following pattern of umbilical arteries on a Doppler. What does this pattern indicate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Absence of end-diastolic flow

Absent end-diastolic flow (AEDF) in the umbilical artery is a sign of placental resistance and can indicate fetal vascular stress. It can be a sign of fetal growth restriction (FGR) and is associated with poor fetal and neonatal outcomes.

questions.text: A second gravida with previous CS during repeat CS developed bleeding after delivery of fetus, hysterectomy was done and the specimen is shown below. What is diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Placenta accreta

Placenta Accreta Spectrum (PAS) refers to abnormal placental attachment to the uterine wall, preventing normal separation after delivery. It includes three types:

1.	Placenta Accreta – Placenta attaches too deeply into the uterine wall but does not invade the muscle.

2.	Placenta Increta – Placenta invades the uterine muscle (myometrium).

3.	Placenta Percreta – Placenta penetrates through the entire uterine wall, potentially reaching nearby organs (e.g., bladder).

Risk Factors:

•    Previous C-sections

•    Uterine surgeries

•    Placenta previa

•    Advanced maternal age
